data.title: Sparta, Tennessee
data.text:
(Source: Middle Tennessee Industrial Development Association, 2019 Community Data Profile at www.mtida.org/datasheets/sparta.pdf)

Population: (2020 Estimate)

Sparta 4,998 White County 27,107

Location:

Latitude -- N35º 55.56'

Longitude -- W85º 27.85

Elevation: 925 ft.

Distance from Cookeville -- 15 miles

Distance from Nashville -- 80 miles

Climate:

Average annual temperature -- 58.3 degrees

Average high temperature -- 70.9 degrees

Average low temperature -- 45.6 degrees

Average annual precipitation -- 54.14 inches

Average annual snowfall -- 5.0 inches

Mean freeze-free days -- 190

Tax Structure: (local)

Property tax (rate per $100)

City - $1.05

County - $2.05

Ratio of Assessment:

Residential - 25%

Industrial - 40%

Personal (equipment)

City - 30%

County - 30%

School tax -- none

Hotel/Motel tax -- 5%

Labor Force: (2017 annual average)

County Labor Market Area Civilian Labor 11,940 100,970 Employment 11,490 96,750 Unemployment 470 4,200 Unemployment Rate 4.0% 4.4%

Per capita personal income was $24,035 in 2020. Retail sales were more than $305 million in 2017. Bank deposits as of June 30, 2018, totaled more than $387 million.

Proud Member of the Highlands of Tennessee

Sparta and White County are key players in the Highlands Initiative, an ambitious economic and community development program of the Highlands of Tennessee, a region that also includes Jackson, Putnam and Overton counties. Together, we share the elevation of geography and economics.
